snippet: The survivors, long overshadowed by those of Hiroshima, demand to be heard.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Susan Southard underscores degree to which atomic bombing of Nagasaki has been overshadowed by Hiroshima, despite inherent differences in experiences of two cities; points to narratives of survivors of Nagasaki bombing as important counterpoint to official American narrative of necessity of using nuclear weapons, and indication of dangers of nuclear war.
lead_paragraph: The survivors, long overshadowed by those of Hiroshima, demand to be heard.
